intro: Helipterum polygalifolium var. leucactinum, commonly known as the white-flowered helipterum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while the stems are erect and branching. This variety is noted for its distinctive white ray florets, which set it apart from other varieties of the species.
